    Introduction to tenm package

Extract environmental data by date

Source: R/ex_by_date.R
ex_by_date.Rd

Function to extract environmental data by date. This function generates training and testing data sets using a random partition with a definite proportion.

Usage

ex_by_date(this_species, train_prop = 0.7)

Arguments

this_species

Species Temporal Data object see sp_temporal_data.

train_prop

Numeric. Training proportion. This is the proportion at which each record (occurrences points) will be used as training or testing. A 0.7 train_prop indicates that 70 of the data will be used to train the model, and the other 30 to model itself.

Value

An object of class sp.temporal.env that contains a temporal data.frame (temporal_df) with the following columns: latitude, longitude, year, layer_dates, layers_path, cell_ids_year, and environmental data.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(tenm)
data("abronia")
tempora_layers_dir <- system.file("extdata/bio",package = "tenm")
abt <- tenm::sp_temporal_data(occs = abronia,
                              longitude = "decimalLongitude",
                              latitude = "decimalLatitude",
                              sp_date_var = "year",
                              occ_date_format="y",
                              layers_date_format= "y",
                              layers_by_date_dir = tempora_layers_dir,
                              layers_ext="*.tif$")
abtc <- tenm::clean_dup_by_date(abt,threshold = 10/60)
future::plan("multisession",workers=2)
abex <- tenm::ex_by_date(this_species = abtc,
                         train_prop=0.7)
future::plan("sequential")
}
